title: Patricia Szarvas
text:
Patricia Falco Beccalli (born 21 January 1970 in <a href="Vienna">Vienna</a>, Austria) is a freelance <a href="Discussion%20moderator">moderator</a>, executive <a href="Media%20%28communication%29">media</a> <a href="Coaching">coach</a> and <a href="writer">writer</a>. For over 14 years she was a <a href="finance">financial</a> <a href="journalist">journalist</a> and <a href="News%20presenter">anchor</a> of <a href="CNBC%20Europe">CNBC TV</a> based in <a href="London">London</a>. Moving on to <a href="Germany">Germany</a>, she reported daily from the <a href="Frankfurt">Frankfurt</a> <a href="stock%20exchange">stock exchange</a> on business and financial markets for many international studios of the CNBC network. She also reported for the German television station <a href="N24%20%28Germany%29">N24</a>. Prior to CNBC she worked for the Italian broadcaster <a href="RAI%203">RAI 3</a> in <a href="Rome">Rome</a>.
Biography.
After studying Economics and Communications Patricia Falco Beccalli worked as a <a href="broker">broker</a>, private <a href="banker">banker</a> and <a href="portfolio%20%28finance%29">portfolio manager</a> in <a href="Frankfurt">Frankfurt</a>, <a href="London">London</a> and <a href="Luxembourg">Luxembourg</a> and was a registered <a href="stockbroker">stockbroker</a> at the <a href="London%20Stock%20Exchange">London Stock Exchange</a>. She speaks five languages, German, <a href="English%20language">English</a>, <a href="French%20language">French</a>, <a href="Italian%20language">Italian</a> and Slovak. She has a daughter born in 2005.
From 1989 to 1999 she headed the stock exchange news department at the <a href="Italy">Italian</a> public service broadcaster <a href="RAI">RAI</a>. In 1999 she joined CNBC in <a href="London">London</a>, where she became the co-anchor of the business news programmes "<a href="Morning%20Exchange%20%28CNBC%20Europe%29">Morning Exchange</a>" and "<a href="Power%20Lunch%20Europe">Power Lunch Europe</a>". She was the main contributor to CNBC's <a href="Capital%20Connection%20%28TV%20series%29">Capital Connection</a>, <a href="Worldwide%20Exchange">Worldwide Exchange</a> and <a href="Squawk%20Box%20Europe">Squawk Box Europe</a>. She also was chief reporter for the <a href="automotive%20industry">automotive industry</a>.
Patricia Falco Beccalli also moderates international political summits, economic and corporate conferences, such as the <a href="World%20Economic%20Forum">World Economic Forum</a> (WEF) in <a href="Davos">Davos</a>, <a href="Digital%20Life%20Design">Digital Life Design</a> (DLD) in <a href="Munich">Munich</a>, Northern Light in <a href="Helsinki">Helsinki</a>, Euro Finance Week in <a href="Frankfurt">Frankfurt</a>.
Patricia Falco Beccalli is a world renowned venture capitalist
